thread.title: How Zlatan allowed Rooney to outdo John Terry
thread.title_full: How Zlatan allowed Rooney to outdo John Terry

title: How Zlatan allowed Rooney to outdo John Terry
text:
1:23 
UNITED CATCH LIVERPOOL 
United‚Äôs EFL Cup win means they have equalled the major trophies tally of rivals Liverpool. 
Whether your count Club World Cups, Intercontinental Cups and UEFA Super Cups is irrelevant. 
With the inclusion of those competitions, both United and the Reds have 44 trophies. Without them, they both have 41. 
United‚Äôs trophy cabinet: 20 league titles, 12 FA Cups, 4 League Cups, 3 European Cups, 1 Cup Winners‚Äô Cup, 1 UEFA Super Cup, 1 Club World Cup and 1 Intercontinental Cup. 
Reds‚Äô trophy cabinet: 18 league titles, 7 FA Cups, 8 League Cups, 5 European Cups, 3 UEFA Cups and 3 UEFA Super Cups. Manchester United's Zlatan Ibrahimovic holds the trophy. Source: AP 
WHY JOSE‚ÄôS EMOTION HINTS HE‚ÄôS NOT QUITTING ANYTIME SOON 
Mourinho confirmed that he was emotional after claiming his first major trophy since winning the Premier League with Chelsea before being sacked four months later. 
The 54-year-old is the first United manager to win major silverware in his maiden season at Old Trafford. 
He is also only the third manager ever to win the League Cup four times, after lifting the trophy three times with Chelsea. 
‚ÄúI‚Äôm a bit emotional, yes. It‚Äôs not easy to win titles so many times, it‚Äôs not easy to cope with that pressure that I put myself under with my career,‚Äù Mourinho said. Manchester United's Portuguese manager Jose Mourinho holds up the trophy. Source: AFP 
But he also noted that if he wasn‚Äôt emotional, then he wouldn‚Äôt be the right man for the job. 
‚ÄúI had my last one [trophy] here for Chelsea and it was as emotional. 
‚ÄúWinning is always special. The day I don‚Äôt get emotional when I win, that‚Äôs the time to go home.‚Äù 
‚ÄúIt was a game that I was feeling the difficulty. I want to pay the homage Southampton deserve and the only thing I can say is we have the cup in our hands, but probably we should be now playing extra-time.‚Äù Saints robbed of opener 
KOEMAN ADDS INSULT TO INJURY FOR FORMER CLUB 
United‚Äôs win over Southampton wasn‚Äôt just great news for Red Devils fans. 
So long as the Red Devils finish in the Premier League‚Äôs top five places, the sixth-placed team can now still qualify for the Europa League. 
That will come as a boost to Everton, who will fancy their chances of finishing in that spot. 
No one was more happy than former Saints boss and current Toffees manager Ronald Koeman, who took to Twitter to celebrate. The best result for @Everton 7th place Europe? @SouthamptonFC can be proud! üëç ‚Äî Ronald Koeman (@RonaldKoeman) February 26, 2017 
PIE GATE ON THE BUS TO THE FINAL 
Former Sutton United reserve goalkeeper Wayne Shaw once again went viral on social media before the EFL Cup final. 
Shaw is a Southampton fan and was on the bus to Wembley with Saints supporters when the ‚ÄòPie Gate‚Äô banter kicked in. Terrific scenes as Wayne Shaw travels to the EFL Cup Final. Banter.
